taskDescription: The amino acid methionine is formed by a methylation reaction of homocysteine with N-methyltetrahydrofolate. The stereochemistry of the reaction has been probed by carrying out the transformation using a donor with a “chiral methyl group,” which contains protium (H), deuterium (D), and tritium (T) isotopes of hydrogen. Does the methylation reaction occur with inversion or retention of configuration?
